channel.title: Server not running but it says its online?
channel.description:
When ive opened my run.bat it says its Online.
but when i try to log on with my account it dont work it says " Error Connecting To Server " please help rep++ i tryed all types of account still dont work i portforwarded 100% correctly.

item.title: Server not running but it says its online?
item.dc:creator: @javamantle javamantle
item.description:
@javamantle wrote:

here’s a qucik tut to portfarward
You need utorrent
First run your no-ip (make sure its on)
2.run your server(make sure your correcting to ur no-ip and to the 43594 port)
3.Open utorrent right click options then click preferences and then to connection
(make sure it looks like this) :

Then close it
And Bam You have just portfarwarded!
Hope this helped

item.source: Server not running but it says its online?

item.title: Server not running but it says its online?
item.dc:creator: @sjustin1996 sjustin1996
item.description:
@sjustin1996 wrote:

Possible problems:

  1. Your no-ip address is wrong (it connects to the wrong IP). In this case, you may have edited the IP input section, which should be left alone.
  2. Your client has the wrong IP in it, or you are typing the wrong IP should this be an IP-Changer client.
  3. Your IPv4 address changed, open cmd.exe and type ipconfig to make sure that you still have the right IP portforwarded.
  4. Your IPv4 address was just plain never put in correctly to portforward.
  5. You have no connection (you couldn’t post here if that was the case, so that’s not a problem here).
  6. You changed the wrong IP in your client - Sometimes there will be more than one file that the IP is stored in to connect to. EDIT: Assuming the client isn’t made by you.

Read full topic
item.source: Server not running but it says its online?

item.title: Server not running but it says its online?
item.dc:creator: @dgk_all_day1 dgk_all_day
item.description:
@dgk_all_day1 wrote:

you havent portfowarded correctly or your no-ip address that you should have put into your client is incorrect…try changing your client ip to local host 127.0.0.1 if it cannot connect then idk

and if you have your no-ip address in your client and it does not let you connect but your local host did “127.0.0.1” then you have not portfowarded properly firewal most likly blocking no-ip or your server

i have only been doing this a few weeks rep if it helps

Read full topic
